page.title: 03CHANGING TIMES IN AMBERLEY 2
page.content: post office and general store.Most people who lived in the village used to be employed by Parham Estate, The Chalk Pits,The Castle Estate, and the ten farms. Three main farms now remain. Many retired people from these occupations still live in the village but their children and grandchildren have had to move away because houses are very expensive and there are now few local jobs. Most of the estate and farm cottages have been sold to people who have retired, commute or use the house as a second home. People rely mainly on their cars for transport because the bus service stopped in 1976 and the train service keeps on being reduced. The railway station is at Houghton and the service keeps on being reduced. Since the ferry closed it is a 4 mile instead of 1 mile journey between villages.
